snippet: Most people think of New York’s undercover spying as a phenomenon afflicting Muslims, but it has also been connected to the Republican National Convention, bike rides and Occupy Wall Street.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column observes that most people think of New York’s police spying and surveillance as a collection of isolated events, when in fact undercover spying is omnipresent.
lead_paragraph: Most people think of New York’s undercover spying as a phenomenon afflicting Muslims, but it has also been connected to the Republican National Convention, bike rides and Occupy Wall Street.

headline.main: On Reed-Thin Evidence, a Very Wide Net of Police Surveillance
headline.print_headline: On Reed-Thin Evidence, a Very Wide Net of Police Surveillance
